creator: juergen@essex.ac.uk
text:
In the conf/web.xml file, for the element <welcome-file-list>, the entry 
	<welcome-file>
            help.jsp
      </welcome-file>
is never accepted as the default page, even if help.jsp is there and is the only file. Only entries starting with index, e.g. index.jsp, index.html, etc., are accepted.

creator: nacho@apache.org
text:
AFAIK conf/web.xml is not used on Tomcat 3.2.X nor in Tomcat 3.3..

So this can be your real problem?

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
conf/web.xml isn't used in 3.3 nor 3.2, you must use your webapp's web.xml
in order for your app to be portable ( otherwise you'll try to deploy on a
different system and it'll just fail ). All app config should be in the app, 
not in the server.
